I‚Äôve been saving up the cashback with the plan to eventually make a substantial transfer back into my credits, so I wanted to share a suggestion that could add value for both users and the platform.

The 3% is definitely helpful, but when you consider it in the context of frequent high-value purchases, like the $99.99 transactions many of us make, the benefit is still quite small. Users who purchase often, myself included, engage with the app extensively, and I think there‚Äôs a great opportunity to recognise and further encourage that loyalty.

One idea could be a tiered loyalty cashback system, for example:
After three purchases, the cashback percentage could increase;
After five purchases, it could increase again;
And for users who reach ten purchases, an enhanced reward could apply, such as receiving 2,700 additional free credits after making a $99.99 purchase. This would be a bonus on top of the purchase, not replacing the standard credits.
Even small increases like these would make a meaningful difference for users who consistently support the platform, while still being minimal compared to the overall spend. It would genuinely feel like value being added back to loyal users and would continue encouraging long-term engagement.
Copy-paste would also be helpful .
